body_html:
Is it the first call, or can it be the second call? If it's the first call, it could have something to do with CUDA generating PTX, which happens the first time op is executed and is slow (and mega-slow if you are on nfs, set CUDA_CACHE_PATH=/non_nfs_dir). Whether or not PTX has to be generated depends on whether the binary was built with compute capability of your card

Does the problem disappear if you revert to older version? Does it happen with CPU-only TensorFlow?

body:
Is it the first call, or can it be the second call? If it's the first call, it could have something to do with CUDA generating PTX, which happens the first time op is executed and is slow (and mega-slow if you are on nfs, set CUDA_CACHE_PATH=/non_nfs_dir). Whether or not PTX has to be generated depends on whether the binary was built with compute capability of your card

Does the problem disappear if you revert to older version? Does it happen with CPU-only TensorFlow?
